ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! It is truly a reminder
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Never so, as this is a reminder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: There is no doubt that the Quran is a guide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Yes indeed, this is an advice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay, verily, this is an admonition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! it is surely an admonition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed; surely it is a Reminder;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, verily. Lo! this is an Admonishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but this is truly a reminder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! Verily this Qur'an is an Admonition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No! It is indeed a reminder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nay, this surely is an admonition:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, verily, this (Quran) is an admonition,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No, indeed, surely, this is a Reminder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! Indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:54] No indeed! (kallā: a commencement [of a new sentence]) Assuredly it, that is, the Qur’ān, is a Reminder, an   admonition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, verily) Muhammad. (Lo! this is an Admonishment) whoever wishes to take admonition from the Qur'an, will be admonished.
